text: I have never played tennis before.
I have been very briefly introduced to the game, but I have difficulty playing the game due to a lack of consistency in rallying and serving.
I can get the ball in play but lack control, resulting in inconsistent rallies. I often chooses to hit forehands instead of backhands.
I can rally 10 balls in a row, especially on the forehand, with an arched trajectory over the net when the objective is to hit to a partner at moderate speed.

I am able to rally consistently 10 balls in a row on forehands and backhands. I am able to maintain a rally when receiving high, short, or wide balls, assuming the ball is received at a moderate pace, especially on the forehand side.
I am able to move the opponent around the court or hit harder when receiving easier balls. I can execute approach shots with some consistency (more than 50% success rate).

I am able to develop points with some consistency by using a reliable combination of shots. I am erratic when attempting a quality shot, when receiving fast or wide balls, and when attempting passing shots.

I can use a variety of spins. I am beginning to develop a dominant shot or good steadiness. I am erratic when attempting a quality shot in two of the following situations: receiving fast balls, wide balls, and in passing shot situations.

I am able to maintain a consistent rally, 10 balls in a row on faster balls. I have very steady strokes or a dominant shot. I periodically succeed (50% success rate) when attempting a quality shot when receiving fast or wide balls, and in passing shot situations.
I have an inconsistent return. I tend to position myself in a manner to protect weaknesses.
In singles, I am consistent when returning towards the middle of the court. In doubles, I have difficulty returning crosscourt to start the point.
I can control the direction of the ball in both singles and doubles, when receiving a serve of moderate pace.

I can return fast serves or well-placed serves with defensive actions. When receiving an easy second serve, I can return with pace or directional control; I can approach the net in doubles after returning.

I only have difficulty in returning spin serves when receiving very fast serves. On moderately paced serves, I can construct the point through hitting a good shot or exploiting an opponent's weakness. In doubles, I can vary returns effectively on moderately paced serves.

Off first serves, I can defend consistently but very inconsistent (less then 30% success) when attempting an aggressive return. In doubles, I have difficulty (less than 50% success) when returning a first serve into the feet of the incoming serve and volleyer.

I periodically succeed (50% success) at sending an aggressive return off fast first serves using my dominant shot (forehand or backhand). In doubles, I can return at the feet of serve and volleyer consistently.
In singles, I am reluctant to come to the net. In doubles, I understand the basic positioning, but I am only comfortable only with the forehand volley; I avoid the backhand volley and overhead.
I have become at ease at the net in practice but I am uncomfortable in a game situation
I am very consistent on the forehand volley with easy balls, but I am inconsistent on the backhand volley. Overall, I have difficulty with low and wide balls. I can smash easy lobs.

I have become confident at the net. I can direct forehand volleys; I can control the backhand volley but with little offense; I have general difficulty in putting volleys away. I can handle volleys and overheads that require moderate movement.

In singles, I am comfortable with following an approach shot to the net. In doubles, I am comfortable receiving a variety of balls and converting to offensive positioning; I can poach on weak returns of serve. I am able to put away easy overheads.

When coming to the net after serving, I am consistently able to put the first volley in play but without pace or depth; however, I am inconsistent when trying to volley powerful or angled returns. Close to the net, I can finish a point using various options including the drop volley, angle volley, punch volley.
In singles, I am very comfortable at the net in any situation. In doubles, after the serve, I have a good, deep crosscourt volley. Overhead can be hit from almost any position.
I have an incomplete service motion. My toss is inconsistent. Double faults are common for me unless serving underhand.
I am attempting a full service motion on the first serve. My frst serve in inconsistent (less than 50% success). I use an incomplete motion to ensure a steady second serve.
I use a full motion on both first and second serves. I am able to achieve more than 50% success on the first serve. My second serve is much slower than my first serve.
I can vary the speed or direction of my first serve. I can direct my second serve to the opponent's weakness without double-faulting on a regular basis.
I can vary the speed and direction of the first serve. I use spin on my serves.

I have an aggressive first serve with power and spin. My second serve frequently hits the court with good depth and placement. I can serve and volley after my first serves in doubles, but experience some inconsistency.
My first serve can win points outright, or force a weak return. My second serve can prevent the opponent from attacking. I serve and volley off the first serve in doubles with consistency.

I am capable of competing in 'open' category provincial level tournaments. I have developed a gamestyle which is recognizable as either an all-court player, an aggressive baseliner, a serve and volleyer, or a retriever. I have developed good anticipation either technically (can read toss on serve, body position…) or tactically (can read opponents tendencies in specific situations). I have no major weaknesses and can counterattack effectively against a hard ball, wide ball, or in passing shot situations. I have the ability to use specific shots in order to exploit opponent’s weakness: drop-shot, lob, angle, moonball…

I have extensive international 'open' level tournament experience at the entry professional level (challenger or satellite experience). My rankings or past rankings will speak for themselves. I have had intensive training for national tournament competition at the junior level and collegiate levels and have obtained a provincial and/or national 'open' ranking.
None of the above.
